exercise.title: 8 There is/are; prepositions
exercise.sentence: # a toy box in the bedroom. There Is there There’s

# two pillows on the bed.
There are There is There’s

There's #
a book on the shelf. books on the shelf. five books on the shelf.

sentence.ans: There’s boys in the living room.
There are a boy in the living room.
There’s a boy in the living room.

exercise.sentence: There are # three dolls. a doll. doll.

sentence.ans: There is teddy in the bedroom.
There's a teddy in the bedroom.
There a teddy in the bedroom.
There are a chair in the living room.
There are two chairs in the living room.
There is two chairs in the living room.
There's a ball under the tree.

exercise.sentence:
There's a book #
on the shelf. on shelf. in the shelf.

Is there #
a bed on the room? a bed in the room? two beds in the room?

sentence.ans: There are three dolls on swing.
There are three dolls on the swing.
There are three dolls on a swings.
Is there a car under the bed?
Is there car under the bed?
Are there a car under the bed?

exercise.sentence:
Is there a bed in the room? #
No, there doesn’t. No, it isn’t. No, there isn’t.

Is there a shirt in the cupboard? #
Yes, is. Yes, there isn’t. Yes, there is.

Is there a train in the toy box? No, there #
is. are. isn’t.
